channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead deer on slip road M5 Jct 11A onto A417, 30th July
item.description:
Dead deer on slip road M5 Jct 11A onto A417 about half way down sliproad Https://what3words.com/tweaked.head.roadblock
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth Bypass, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light sequence is all wrong, 30th July
item.description:
For months, these lights have been a massive bottleneck for traffic heading into Cheltenham from Bishops Cleeve. This gas a knock on effect around Swindon Road, Tewkesbury Road and on the Roundabout. This has been reported numerous times and still nothing done! SORT IT OUT!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: The pavement is dangerous in places, as it is overgrown with vegetation, 30th July
item.description:
Sections of the pavement from the bus stop at Cheltenham Road, through to Staverton are impassable due to overgrown vegetation. It is dangerous, as pedestrians have to walk in the road from a busy junction. Given all the money spent on the cycle path, surely somene can pop down and cut the hedge back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bicycle dumped, 30th July
item.description:
Bicycle dumped in park. What 3 Words ///maps.trails.logic Stolen?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blake Croft, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 30th July
item.description:
Customer reports that grass/vegetation have encroached on the bus shelter and obscured the Bus Stop sign; some buses have gone past without stopping. Please can we cut this back.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 30th July
item.description:
Trees The tree is damaged The four trees in question are T101, T120, T125 and T127. The survey recommended that all four trees should be felled within the next 12 months i.e. by August 2024 for health and safety reasons as they were in danger of falling.
Report on FixMyStreet
